Articles.Content:
This mod has a conflict with FAR. Whenever the Abaddon-system is installed FAR doesn't work. It works fine for Sentar and Urania though.

I can fix it in V.10, but it isn't ready for release.

Thank you very much sidfu. I was on a camp-out this weekend, if you were wondering.

Thanks for helping people who needed assistance with the mod.

Download Sido's Urania system pack. Does that work? If it does than it is a problem with my mod, not the API.

Only the sample Systems that come with Planet Factory and Sentar work. None of the other systems work.

Only the sample Systems that come with Planet Factory and Sentar work. None of the other systems work.

It's a problem with your computer then. Ask Krag.

Pretty sure Umbrire isn't supposed to look like this.

If I'm close enough and in a ship, it looks fine. I've tried messing about with my graphics settings to fix this, but to no avail. If anyone wants to try to reproduce it, my graphics settings are:

Terrain Detail: Low

SM3 Terrain Shaders: Off

Terrain Scatters: Off

Scatter Density: 50%

Rendering Quality Level: Fast

Texture Quality: 1/4 Res

Fallback Part Shaders: False

Aerodynamic FX Quality: Minimal

Resolution: 1280 x 800

Full Screen: Enabled

Anti-aliasing: 2x

V Sync: Every VBlank

Frame limit: 60 FPS

Pixel Light Count: 8

Shadow Cascades: 4

This is on a Macbook Pro (YES YES I KNOW TERRIBLE FOR GAMING ETC ETC) with a 512 MB Intel HD 3000 graphics card.

The next step is to see if there are any mod conflicts.

EDIT: Just tested, got this with just Stock parts, PlanetFactory CE (with Barry, Serious, and Stella removed,) Sido's Urania system, and the Abbadon system.

Edited February 9, 2014 by Whovian

Yes.

(10char)

Fixed in V.09.

It's caused by the template planets being mismatched in the Umbrire config file. Just press Ctrl-9 while in orbit around Umbrire and click "create scaled." If that doesn't work, I'll push a fix in V.10.

Is it alternis kerbol compatible?

I haven't ever tested it. I don't think so.

Fixed in V.09.

It's caused by the template planets being mismatched in the Umbrire config file. Just press Ctrl-9 while in orbit around Umbrire and click "create scaled." If that doesn't work, I'll push a fix in V.10.

Hmm. KSP seems to freeze, running at a core's capacity, not responding whenever I do that. Tested it on Thud; it only lasted a few seconds there, but the "Create Scaled" freeze seems to not be ending on Umbrire.

Hmm. KSP seems to freeze, running at a core's capacity, not responding whenever I do that. Tested it on Thud; it only lasted a few seconds there, but the "Create Scaled" freeze seems to not be ending on Umbrire.

Go into the config for Umbrire and post it here. I'll find the mistake. Remember to use code tags.

The final To-do and indev list:

Please note that I will not be adding any new features besides bug fixes until after all of the level 3 goals are complete.

Level 3 Goals - larger additions and indev features

Celestial Bodies:

New star called Patoroa. Orbits closer to Kerbol than Abaddon.

- New gas giant "Antsur." A cream color with rings.

- Ice moon "Sudalce." An icy Enceladus analogue.

- Ice moon "Apora." Europa analogue.

- Titan-like moon "Nisat"

- Hot Jupiter "Vollo." Very purple.

- Rocky moon "Limas." Mimas analogue.

- Rocky moon "Nirana." Miranda analogue.

- Rocky moon "Dulli." Iapetus analogue.

- Ocean moon "Kappi." Either no surface whatsoever or some tiny islands.

Misc.

- Cloud mod integration.

- Completion of all science situations.

- Biome integration.

- Miscellaneous performance tweaks and bug fixes.

Level 2 Goals - long-term goals

Celestial Bodies:

- A Kragesque planet pack.

Misc.

- Coloured atmospheres

- Comets and asteroids

Level 1 Goals - Far-fetched guesses.

Celestial Bodies

- At least 3 more packs.

- Sol system pack: adds the Solar system into Kerbal Space Program.

Misc.

- Making a super massive black hole the universal SOI, or just changing Kerbol's texture into a black hole and moving the stock planets.

- Guess. I'll tell you if you're right.
Lol, I have more than 10 modes but I just failed to install this one. Even using the manual.
This sounds like the perfect companion to the Interstellar mod. Gives a warpship someplace awesome to go
Porry - when do you think v10 will be up?

Porry - when do you think v10 will be up?

As soon as I'm ungrounded. Basically I had the textures ready but I was grounded before I could set up the configs.

Edited February 10, 2014 by Poryy
Looking for a YouTube video to be made showcasing this pack.

Go into the config for Umbrire and post it here. I'll find the mistake. Remember to use code tags.

PFBody
{
	name= Umbrire
	templateName=Minmus
	flightGlobalsIndex=750
	clearPQS=true	
}

CelestialBody
{
	bodyDescription= The moon of Fantoma. This moon is strangely large compared to it's parent body.
	GeeASL=0.4
	//Radius=240000
	rotates=True
	rotationPeriod=4040
	initialRotation=180
	tidallyLocked=True
}

Orbit
{
	inclination = 0
	eccentricity = 0.0
	semiMajorAxis = 9000000
	LAN = 0
	argumentOfPeriapsis = 0
	meanAnomalyAtEpoch = 0
	epoch = 0
	referenceBody = Fantoma
}	
ScaledExport
{
	templateName=Minmus
	mapWidth=2048
	maxHeight=10000
	hasOcean=false
	oceanHeight=0.0
	exportBin=True
	removeAlpha=False
}

PQS
{
	//radius=350000
	minLevel=1
	maxLevel=10
}
PQSMod_PFOffset
{
	modEnabled=True
	offset=500
	order=5
}

PQSMod_VertexHeightMap
{
	modEnabled=True
	//order=160
	heightMap=Umbrire_height.png
	heightMapDeformity=9000
	heightMapOffset=0
	scaleDeformityByRadius=True
}
PQSMod_VertexColorMap
{
	modEnabled=True
	//order=150
	vertexColorMap=Umbrire_color.png
}

PFBody
{
	name= Umbrire
	templateName=Minmus
	flightGlobalsIndex=750
	clearPQS=true	
}

CelestialBody
{
	bodyDescription= The moon of Fantoma. This moon is strangely large compared to it's parent body.
	GeeASL=0.4
	//Radius=240000
	rotates=True
	rotationPeriod=4040
	initialRotation=180
	tidallyLocked=True
}

Orbit
{
	inclination = 0
	eccentricity = 0.0
	semiMajorAxis = 9000000
	LAN = 0
	argumentOfPeriapsis = 0
	meanAnomalyAtEpoch = 0
	epoch = 0
	referenceBody = Fantoma
}	
ScaledExport
{
	templateName=Minmus
	mapWidth=2048
	maxHeight=10000
	hasOcean=false
	oceanHeight=0.0
	exportBin=True
	removeAlpha=False
}

PQS
{
	//radius=350000
	minLevel=1
	maxLevel=10
}
PQSMod_PFOffset
{
	modEnabled=True
	offset=500
	order=5
}

PQSMod_VertexHeightMap
{
	modEnabled=True
	//order=160
	heightMap=Umbrire_height.png
	heightMapDeformity=9000
	heightMapOffset=0
	scaleDeformityByRadius=True
}
PQSMod_VertexColorMap
{
	modEnabled=True
	//order=150
	vertexColorMap=Umbrire_color.png
}

Looks right. Just press create scaled and wait.

Looks right. Just press create scaled and wait.

Did that; KSP's been on freeze for about 5 minutes now. How long should it take?

Did that; KSP's been on freeze for about 5 minutes now. How long should it take?

Just let it stew overnight. I have no idea why it's taking so longZ I need my computer for access to the planet's files.
So are these stars in a high Kerbol orbit, or are they in fixed positions relative to Kerbol? The OP doesn't really say, and the only mention I found of it in the thread was near the beginning...

I'm pretty sure, as the map view shows an orbit, that Abbadon's in high Kerbol orbit.

EDIT: Couldn't find a reference to orbital period in the config, so I assume KSP calculates it from some formula (does it go like r or r^2 or something?) I'm guessing this is in the core game's programming and can't be fixed.

Edited February 11, 2014 by Whovian

I'm pretty sure, as the map view shows an orbit, that Abbadon's in high Kerbol orbit.

EDIT: Couldn't find a reference to orbital period in the config, so I assume KSP calculates it from some formula (does it go like r or r^2 or something?) I'm guessing this is in the core game's programming and can't be fixed.

Believe me. If it weren't in the core game's code, I would have everything orbiting around a black hole.

Believe me. If it weren't in the core game's code, I would have everything orbiting around a black hole.

hehe, now that would be a scary mission. Land on asteroid a few meters off the event horizon of a black hole.

hehe, now that would be a scary mission. Land on asteroid a few meters off the event horizon of a black hole.

Being evil, I think I have an excellent idea. I will call it the "Masochist Pack" and it shall be ready in 2056 at this rate of development.

Devnote:

I actually went with relatively photorealistic planets this time. They really do look good. I suppose I'm going to put an Iapetus analogue, Mimas analogue, and Miranda analogue into orbit around Antsur too, because Saturnstuff
